title: –í–æ–π—Ü–µ—Ö–æ–≤—Å–∫–∏–π "–±–ª–∞–≥–æ–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω" –∑–∞ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–µ—Å—Ç—ã —Ñ–µ—Ä–º–µ—Ä–æ–≤, CAP –¥–æ–ª–∂–µ–Ω –æ—Å–Ω–æ–≤—ã–≤–∞—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç–∏–º—É–ª–∞—Ö,
title_en: Wojciechowski is "grateful" for farmers' protests, CAP should be based on incentives,
summary_en:
EU Commissioner for Agriculture Janusz Wojciechowski thanks farmers for the protests, which helped to ensure a quick solution to problems through the Common Agricultural Policy (CAP).
The final stages of negotiations and the entry into force of the reform aimed at improving environmental friendliness marked the beginning of the current EU legislation.
EU institutions have responded to the demonstrations by adopting a package of measures that weaken environmental requirements for farmers' access to environmental protection.
Wojciechowski believes that in order to achieve ambitious goals, the focus should be on incentives rather than commitments.
He calls for long transition periods and security mechanisms to prevent destabilization of the EU market when Ukraine joins the bloc.
Wojciechowski insists on increasing the limit and budget to combat the crisis in agriculture to ensure the stability of farms.
He calls for the establishment of farmers' representation at the EU and national levels to support farmers' organizations and producer associations.

title: –¢–∞—Ä–∏—Ñ—ã: –ü—Ä–æ—Ñ—Å–æ—é–∑: –∑–¥–µ—Å—å –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞—é—Ç—Å—è –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –Ω–∞ —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–π–∫–µ
title_en: Tariffs: Trade Union: strikes at the construction site begin here
summary_en:
Strikes at the construction site threaten to begin next Monday in Lower Saxony.
The IG Built Agricultural Environment organization announced this in Frankfurt.
Strikes will be carried out point-by-point throughout Germany in the main construction industry.
Lower Saxony was chosen because of local employers preventing the implementation of the arbitration award.
The central rally will be held in Osnabr√ºck on Monday.
The employers rejected the arbitration decision, criticizing its formal errors and the difficult economic situation in the industry.
The IG BAU organization adopted the decision of the former chairman of the Federal Social Court Rainer Schlegel on arbitration.
Employers want to raise employees' salaries on a voluntary basis.
The main union of the German construction industry has offered companies to contribute 5% in the west and 6% in the east.
The construction industry is one of the largest employers in Germany and an important pillar of the German economy.

title: –ö–∞–Ω–Ω—Å–∫–æ–º—É –∫–∏–Ω–æ—Ñ–µ—Å—Ç–∏–≤–∞–ª—é –≥—Ä–æ–∑–∏—Ç —Å—Ä—ã–≤ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –ø—Ä–∞–≤ —Å–µ–∑–æ–Ω–Ω—ã—Ö —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤
title_en: Cannes Film Festival faces strike disruption over seasonal workers' rights
summary_en:
A strike and protests by projectionists, hall managers and press agents are expected at the Cannes Film Festival.
The Sous les √âcrans la D√®che team represents the interests of more than 200 employees demanding a change in the attitude of the French government towards the staff of seasonal film festivals.
The workers are hired on short-term seasonal contracts at film festivals throughout France, but are not covered by the French unemployment insurance program for freelance performers.
Changes to the unemployment system in France, which will be introduced in early July, will put seasonal film festival workers in an even more difficult position.
The team demands a meeting with key Cannes employees and representatives of the Ministry of Economy to develop specific plans to protect festival workers.
There are fears that as the new #MeToo movement in French cinema gains momentum, the festival may suffer from new revelations of sexual harassment.

title: –ú—É—Å–æ—Ä–Ω–∞—è –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∞: –∂–∏—Ç–µ–ª–µ–π –ë—Ä—é—Å—Å–µ–ª—è –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏–ª–∏ –≤–µ—Ä–Ω—É—Ç—å –Ω–µ—É–±—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –º—É—Å–æ—Ä –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–Ω–æ –≤ –¥–æ–º–∞
title_en: Garbage strike: residents of Brussels were asked to return the uncollected garbage back to their homes
summary_en:
A strike by garbage collection staff in Brussels has prompted calls for residents to bring their untidy garbage bags.
Orange bags for organic waste create interference and can cause an unpleasant odor due to an increase in temperature.
Employees of the Brussels real Estate Agency went on strike on Friday, May 10.
The strike led to the disruption of garbage collection in several communes.
Regional recreation parks are open, with the exception of Recypark South.
Many residents of the city do not know about the strike and continue to throw garbage into the street.
ABP summarized the impact of the strike, which varies greatly from municipality to municipality.
The Brussels administration is calling on residents and traders to return the untidy garbage bags by Saturday evening.
The strikers want to condemn the accumulation of holidays and demand that employees be granted leave due to the large number of absenteeism.

title: –¢–∞—Ä–∏—Ñ—ã: –ì–æ—Ä–æ–¥—Å–∫–∞—è –∂–µ–ª–µ–∑–Ω–∞—è –¥–æ—Ä–æ–≥–∞ –≤ –•–µ–º–Ω–∏—Ü–µ —Å–Ω–æ–≤–∞ –±–∞—Å—Ç—É–µ—Ç
title_en: Fares: The Chemnitz City Railway is on strike again
summary_en:
Restrictions on public transport are expected in the Chemnitz area on Saturday due to a malfunction of the city railway.
The GDL machinists' union called for a strike due to the ongoing collective dispute and the refusal of employers to introduce a 35-hour work week.
Employees of the city railway stopped working from Wednesday until noon on Friday.
GDL warns of possible new strikes, which will be longer and tougher if the employer continues to refuse to cooperate.
GDL regrets the consequences for passengers, but the responsibility lies with the employer.

title: –¢—É–Ω–∏—Å—Å–∫–∏–µ —é—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–∏–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç –∫ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–µ –≤ —Å–≤—è–∑–∏ —Å –∞—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–æ–º –∏—Ö –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∏ –Ω–∞ —Ñ–æ–Ω–µ –ø–æ–¥–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏—è –∏–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º—ã—Å–ª–∏—è
title_en: Tunisian lawyers are calling for a strike in connection with the arrest of their colleague amid a crackdown on dissent
summary_en:
Tunisian lawyers are calling for a strike over the arrest of their colleague amid a crackdown on dissent.
The police raided the headquarters of the Tunisian Bar Association and arrested the lawyer.
Sonia Dahmani, a well-known government critic, was arrested after making sarcastic remarks about Tunisia.
She became the latest dissident to be charged under the controversial Decree 54.
The Tunisian Council of Lawyers has called on all lawyers to go on a nationwide strike.
The lawyer's arrest has provoked outrage and condemnation from human rights activists in Tunisia.

title: –¢—É–Ω–∏—Å—Å–∫–∏–µ —é—Ä–∏—Å—Ç—ã –ø—Ä–∏–∑—ã–≤–∞—é—Ç –∫ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–µ –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –∞—Ä–µ—Å—Ç–∞ –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∏ –∑–∞ —Å–∞—Ä–∫–∞—Å—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫—É—é —Ç–µ–ª–µ–≤–∏–∑–∏–æ–Ω–Ω—É—é —à—É—Ç–∫—É
title_en: Tunisian lawyers call for strike over arrest of colleague for sarcastic TV joke
summary_en:
Tunisian lawyers are calling for a nationwide strike over the arrest of a colleague for a sarcastic TV joke.
The authorities have intensified large-scale government repression, which has trapped political dissidents, non-governmental organizations and black migrants.
Sonia Dahmani, a well-known government critic, was arrested for sarcastic remarks against Tunisia and charged with spreading false information and disturbing public order.
The Tunisian Council of Lawyers on Sunday called on all lawyers to go on a nationwide strike.
Dahmani's lawyers gathered at the bar association to protest the warrant for her arrest when police stormed the building.
Masked policemen forced the FRANCE 24 TV channel to stop broadcasting after they tore off the "camera from the tripod" and briefly detained the operator.
Dahmani's arrest was the latest in a series of arrests and investigations targeting activists, journalists and civil society groups critical of Saeed and the government.

title: –°–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–∏ Apple Store –≤ –ú—ç—Ä–∏–ª–µ–Ω–¥–µ –ø—Ä–æ–≥–æ–ª–æ—Å–æ–≤–∞–ª–∏ –∑–∞ —Ä–∞–∑—Ä–µ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—É—é –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É –∏–∑-–∑–∞ —É—Å–ª–æ–≤–∏–π —Ç—Ä—É–¥–∞
title_en: Apple Store employees in Maryland voted to allow the first strike due to working conditions
summary_en:
Apple Store employees in Maryland voted to allow the first strike due to working conditions.
The store's employees also sanctioned the first strike against the tech giant's retail activities.
The vote followed "more than a year of negotiations with Apple management, which led to unsatisfactory results."
The workers are seeking changes to the "unpredictable" work schedule and want wages to match the local cost of living.
Employees of a store in a Baltimore suburb voted by a margin of almost 2 to 1 to unionize in June 2022.
Retail, service, and high-tech businesses must be organized to provide greater job protection.
Apple did not immediately respond to an emailed request for comment.

title: –¶–∏—Ñ—Ä—ã –∏ –ø—Ä–∏—á–∏–Ω—ã –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–∏ –≤ –≥–æ—Å—É–¥–∞—Ä—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞–Ω–∏–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ –ú–æ—Ä–µ–Ω–æ –ë–æ–Ω–∏–ª—å–∏ –≤–æ –≤—Ç–æ—Ä–Ω–∏–∫
title_en: Figures and reasons for the strike in public education against Moreno Bonilla on Tuesday
summary_en:
Three trade unions have declared a day of general strike in Andalusia due to unemployment problems in public education.
This is the second time that the Government has faced the problem of unemployment in public education.
The strike occurred after a change in the rules of schooling, according to which preference was given to a private school.
The results of regulatory acts that have had their effect in the context of a decrease in the birth rate are of concern to the authorities.
The unions are calling on the government to "put an end to the policy of closing classrooms in public schools."
They believe that the Andalusian Government is missing a great opportunity to improve the quality of the public system.
Trade unions are negotiating with the government to improve staffing and create a "real quality" education system.

title: Apple —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–æ–≤–∞–ª–∞ –ø–µ—Ä–≤—É—é –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É —Ä–æ–∑–Ω–∏—á–Ω—ã—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–¥–∞–≤—Ü–æ–≤
title_en: Apple has agreed on the first strike of retailers
summary_en:
Apple has agreed on the first strike of retail employees in Maryland.
Members of the International Association of Machinists and Aerospace Workers supported the strike.
The main reason for the strike is to maintain a balance between work and personal life.
Employees have complaints about a company that sets unpredictable tasks for employees.
The Apple store in Maryland was the first where the union entered in 2022.
The problems that prompted Apple retail workers to unite do not concern issues of wages and benefits.

title: –ö–æ–ª–ª–µ–∫—Ç–∏–≤–Ω—ã–π —Å–ø–æ—Ä: —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏—Ç–µ–ª–∏ –±–∞—Å—Ç—É—é—Ç –≤–ø–µ—Ä–≤—ã–µ –∑–∞ 17 –ª–µ—Ç
title_en: Collective dispute: builders strike for the first time in 17 years
summary_en:
The construction industry has launched its first strike in 17 years after unsuccessful collective bargaining.
More than 1,000 construction workers in Lower Saxony have quit their jobs, according to the IG Bau trade union.
The central rally was held in Osnabr√ºck, and a smaller rally was held in Langenhagen in the Hanover area.
450 strikers came to the rallies.
New "spot" strikes in the industry are expected to take place across the country from Tuesday.
The reconciliation attempt failed because of the employers.
The preceding event is the termination of collective arbitration in the main construction industry.
The employers rejected the compromise proposal, and the strike is resumed for demanding 500 euros more per month.
Lower Saxony was chosen to stage a nationwide strike due to opposition from local employers.
The last time there was a nationwide strike at a construction site was in 2002.

title: –ñ—É—Ä–Ω–∞–ª–∏—Å—Ç—ã Rai –≤—ã—Å—Ç—É–ø–∏–ª–∏ –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–≤ " –¢–µ–ª–µ–º–µ–ª–æ–Ω–∏‚Äô
summary_en:
Rai journalists are protesting against "Telemelony" and the daily censorship of the far-right.
Rome is plastered with blue posters depicting Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni.
Journalists complain about the lack of multiplicity in the chain and the pressure to change the approach to information.
The struggle for control of the media in Italy reached its climax with the coming to power of Silvio Berlusconi.
Today, they complain, such a contract no longer exists, and right-wing narratives dominate the entire public communication stream.
The management of the network has just created a new trade union, consisting entirely of minority representatives and holding right-wing views.
Rai's problem is compounded by several ongoing executive branch operations to expand the range of related media.

title: –ë–æ–ª–µ–µ 500 —Ä–∞–±–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ –∞—Ç–æ–º–Ω–æ–π —ç–ª–µ–∫—Ç—Ä–æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω—Ü–∏–∏ –≤ –î—É–Ω—Ä–µ–µ –æ–±—ä—è–≤–∏–ª–∏ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫—É –∏–∑-–∑–∞ –∑–∞—Ä–ø–ª–∞—Ç—ã
title_en: More than 500 workers at the Dunray nuclear power plant have gone on strike over wages
summary_en:
More than 500 workers at the Dunray nuclear power plant have gone on strike over wage disputes.
Unite union members have rejected a revised salary offer from the Nuclear Restoration Services (NRS) employer.
NRS has offered a one-time payment of 500 pounds in addition to the base increase of 4.5%.
Unite reported that 80% of 92% of respondents rejected the deal, considering it a significant reduction in wages in real terms.
Unite has declared its readiness to hold additional strikes if NRS does not take action.
NRS expressed disappointment with the union's decision, but remains committed to finding a fair and reasonable solution.
Unite employees include technical specialists, general operators, chemical engineers and electricians.
Unite is actively considering further action, as NRS does not seem to be able to resolve the dispute through negotiations.

title: –ó–≤–µ–∑–¥–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ –∫–∏–Ω–æ –õ—É–∏ –ì–∞—Ä—Ä–µ–ª—å –ø–æ–¥–¥–µ—Ä–∂–∞–ª –æ–±—ä—è–≤–∏–≤—à–∏—Ö –æ –∑–∞–±–∞—Å—Ç–æ–≤–∫–µ –∫–∏–Ω–æ–º–µ—Ö–∞–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤
title_en: French film star Louis Garrel supported projectionists who announced a strike
summary_en:
The Sous les ecrans la deche group, which unites about 200 employees of French festivals, called on all freelance workers to disrupt the festival.
The participants of the event put on the same badges as a sign of solidarity.
Projectionists, drivers, administrative and technical staff, the press service and the catering service are among those making demands.
About 400 filmmakers, representatives of the European and American film industries have signed an online petition in support of the protesters.
The management of the Cannes Film Festival has declared its readiness to collectively resolve the issues at the negotiating table and avoid a strike.
All of this may be at risk.
Once the Cannes Film Festival was already under threat of disruption.
